channel.title: Arrows key down?
channel.description:
okay
is it possible to do the same function as keydown, but with arrows keys?

perfect thats the way i wanted it(finally someone got it) you get a rep since no one gets it)

item.title: Arrows key down?
item.dc:creator: @ioklio ioklio
item.description:
@ioklio wrote:

I think I know what you mean. Instead of useing this procedure:

SendArrowSilentWait(1, 10);

use this procedure

left = 37 (KeyDown(37)) up = 38 (KeyDown(38)) right = 39 (KeyDown(39)) down = 40 (KeyDown(40))

then to let go of the key do the same but useing KeyUp(number)

hoped this helped in any way

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows key down?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

procedure SendArrowSilentWait(a: Byte; WaitTime: Integer) - Sends an arrow to Client’s window like SendArrowSilent and holds it for a given wait time.
Example: SendArrowSilentWait(1, 10); //holds “Right” arrow for 10 milliseconds.

Is simulating holding the key down. If you haven’t selected the client it will send it anyway. Test it on firefox or somthing.

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows key down?
item.dc:creator: @iruleatants iruleatants
item.description:
@iruleatants wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:4, topic:1402”]procedure SendArrowSilentWait(a: Byte; WaitTime: Integer) - Sends an arrow to Client’s window like SendArrowSilent and holds it for a given wait time.
Example: SendArrowSilentWait(1, 10); //holds “Right” arrow for 10 milliseconds.[/quote]

that send the arrow to the client, i need one that will stimulate pressing the arrows key

like

sendkeysilet-sends key to the client
keydown-presses that key

i want one that does it for arrows(or is it a number in keydown that is arrows)

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows key down?
item.dc:creator: @iruleatants iruleatants
item.description:
@iruleatants wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:2, topic:1402”]procedure SendArrowSilent(a: Byte); - Sends arrow to Client’s window. For a, 0 = up, 1 = right, 2 = down, 3 = left.

Your sig is inacurate. You can be guided to the wilderness. Can you be tutored to the wilderness?[/quote]

its an topic that was deleted but basically the guy told me the a tut is a guide and i was talking about the tut and thats where the sig came from.[br][size=1]Posted at: April 12, 2006, 04:31:51 pm[/size][hr]and also, im looking for the arrows feature that like the keydown and keyup feature

i need to simulate the pressing of the keys,

is there a feature for that?

Read full topic

item.title: Arrows key down?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

procedure SendArrowSilent(a: Byte); - Sends arrow to Client’s window. For a, 0 = up, 1 = right, 2 = down, 3 = left.

Your sig is inacurate. You can be guided to the wilderness. Can you be tutored to the wilderness?

Read full topic
